title: Chapter One
description: Oliver Stone gives background on the Assassination Records Review Board, created by an act of Congress following the controversy of his 1991 film; exploring the aftermath of President Kennedy's assassination, and his brother's early suspicions.

title: Chapter Two
description: An exploration of the strange anomalies in the medical evidence and key differences between the Warren Commission conclusions and the eyewitness testimonies of the doctors who tried to save Kennedy.

title: Chapter Three
description: An exploration of Kennedy's autopsy, from the administrative pathologist who burns his notes, to the official autopsy photographer who claims he did not take the autopsy pictures in the archives of Kennedy's brain.

title: Chapter Four
description: An examination of evidence that surrounds the accused lone nut, Lee Harvey Oswald, and his associations with groups linked to the CIA.
